CODParameter.name: file
CODParameter.Definition: The file parameter is the primary key, i.e. the unique number, defining a crystal saved in the COD database.

CODParameter.name: a
CODParameter.Definition: The lattice parameter a of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: siga
CODParameter.Definition: The standard deviation of the lattice parameter a of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: b
CODParameter.Definition: The lattice parameter b of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: sigb
CODParameter.Definition: The standard deviation of the lattice parameter b of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: c
CODParameter.Definition: The lattice parameter c of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: sigc
CODParameter.Definition: The standard deviation of the lattice parameter c of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: alpha
CODParameter.Definition: The lattice parameter alpha of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: sigalpha
CODParameter.Definition: The standard deviation of the lattice parameter alpha of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: beta
CODParameter.Definition: The lattice parameter beta of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: sigbeta
CODParameter.Definition: The standard deviation of the lattice parameter beta of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: gamma
CODParameter.Definition: The lattice parameter gamma of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: siggamma
CODParameter.Definition: The standard deviation of the lattice parameter gamma of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: vol
CODParameter.Definition: The volume of the crystal structure (calculated by 'cod-tools' from the cell constants).

CODParameter.name: sigvol
CODParameter.Definition: The standard deviation of the volume of the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: celltemp
CODParameter.Definition: The temperature in Kelvins at which the unit-cell parameters were measured (not the temperature of synthesis).

CODParameter.name: sigcelltemp
CODParameter.Definition: The standard deviation of the temperature at which the crystal structure was determined.

CODParameter.name: diffrtemp
CODParameter.Definition: The mean temperature in Kelvins at which the diffraction intensities were measured.

CODParameter.name: sigdiffrtemp
CODParameter.Definition: The standard deviation of the 'diffrtemp' value

CODParameter.name: cellpressure
CODParameter.Definition: The pressure in kilopascals at which the unit-cell parameters were measured.

CODParameter.name: sigcellpressure
CODParameter.Definition: The standard deviation of the 'cellpressure' value.

CODParameter.name: diffrpressure
CODParameter.Definition: The mean hydrostatic pressure in kilopascals at which the intensities were measured.

CODParameter.name: sigdiffrpressure
CODParameter.Definition: The standard deviation of the 'diffrpressure' value

CODParameter.name: thermalhist
CODParameter.Definition: The thermal history of the crystal (human-redabale informal description).

CODParameter.name: pressurehist
CODParameter.Definition: The pressure history of the crystal (human-redabale informal description).

CODParameter.name: nel
CODParameter.Definition: The number of distinct chemical elements in the crystal.

CODParameter.name: sg
CODParameter.Definition: Spacegroup symbol, Hermann-Mauguin or superspacegroup symbol

CODParameter.name: sgHall
CODParameter.Definition: Space-group symbol as described by Hall.

References.Reference: Hall, S. R. (1981). Acta Cryst. A37, 517-525; erratum (1981), A37, 921.
International Tables for Crystallography, Vol. B (2001), Chapter 1.4, Appendix 1.4.2

CODParameter.name: commonname
CODParameter.Definition: Trivial name by which the compound in the crystal is commonly known.

CODParameter.name: chemname
CODParameter.Definition: IUPAC or Chemical Abstracts full name of the compound.

CODParameter.name: mineral
CODParameter.Definition: Mineral name accepted by the International Mineralogical Association.

CODParameter.name: formula
CODParameter.Definition: The summary (brutto) chemical formula that describes the crystal composition, given by the authors.

CODParameter.name: calcformula
CODParameter.Definition: The summary (brutto) formula calculated from the crystal data by the 'cod-tools' package. Ideally, should be the same value as in 'formula'.

CODParameter.name: acce_code
CODParameter.Definition: Acta Crystallographica Coeditor Code. Uniquely identifies a publication by IUCr journals and can be used to construct URL of the paper "landing page".

CODParameter.name: authors
CODParameter.Definition:
The authors that published the paper describing the crystal structure deposited in the COD database, or the authors of the personal communication to COD.
NB.: The name syntax uses the BibTeX convention, which is slightly different from the IUCr convention described under the IUCrDescriptionUrl.

CODParameter.name: title
CODParameter.Definition: The title of the scientific paper where the crystal structure was published.

CODParameter.name: journal
CODParameter.Definition: The name of the journal in which the scientific paper describing the crystal structure was published.

CODParameter.name: year
CODParameter.Definition: The year of publication of this crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: volume
CODParameter.Definition: The volume of the journal where the scientific paper decribing the crystal structure was published.

CODParameter.name: issue
CODParameter.Definition: The issue of the journal where the scientific paper describing the crystal structure was published.

CODParameter.name: firstpage
CODParameter.Definition: The first page of the scientific paper where the crystal structure was published.

CODParameter.name: lastpage
CODParameter.Definition: The last page of the scientific paper where the crystal structure was published.

CODParameter.name: doi
CODParameter.Definition: The DOI that links to the online paper where the crystal was published.

CODParameter.name: method
CODParameter.Definition: The method that was used to determine the crystal structure.
CODParameter.DetailedDescription:
A set of heuristics is used to determine what method (or class of methods) was used to determine the structure. A use of powder diffraction dictionary (data names starting with _pd_) is indicative of powder diffraction. A specified number of single crystals is indicative of singley crystal diffraction. This is often not given, but most of the structures with unspecified method are solved by single crystal diffraction methods...
Future values may include DFT (Density Functional Theory), Theoretical prediction, or an indication of combined methods. Stay tuned ;).
CODParameter.SVNInfo: Name: CIF2COD.pm URL: svn://cod.ibt.lt/cod-tools/trunk/CIFData/CIF2COD.pm Repository Root: svn://cod.ibt.lt/cod-tools Repository UUID: 04be6746-3802-0410-999d-98508da1e98c Revision: 2394 Node Kind: file Schedule: normal Last Changed Author: andrius Last Changed Rev: 2350 Last Changed Date: 2013-11-05 12:05:27 +0200 (Tue, 05 Nov 2013) Text Last Updated: 2013-11-13 16:22:27 +0200 (Wed, 13 Nov 2013) Checksum: 532f4f7d32818e6c4ae084df046e1dab

CODParameter.name: radiation
CODParameter.Definition: The type of radiation that was used to determine the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: wavelength
CODParameter.Definition: The wavelength, in Ångstrøms, that was used to determine the crystal structure.

CODParameter.name: radType
CODParameter.Definition: The type of the radiation used to determine the structure of the crystal. This is used to give a more detailed description than _diffrn_radiation_probe and is typically a description of the X-ray wavelength in Siegbahn notation.

CODParameter.name: radSymbol
CODParameter.Definition: The IUPAC symbol for the X-ray wavelength for the probe radiation.

CODParameter.name: Rall
CODParameter.Definition: Residual factor for all reflections satisfying the resolution limits established by _refine_ls_d_res_high and _refine_ls_d_res_low.
CODParameter.SVNInfo: Name: CIF2COD.pm URL: svn://cod.ibt.lt/cod-tools/trunk/CIFData/CIF2COD.pm Repository Root: svn://cod.ibt.lt/cod-tools Repository UUID: 04be6746-3802-0410-999d-98508da1e98c Revision: 2394 Node Kind: file Schedule: normal Last Changed Author: andrius Last Changed Rev: 2350 Last Changed Date: 2013-11-05 12:05:27 +0200 (Tue, 05 Nov 2013) Text Last Updated: 2013-11-13 16:22:27 +0200 (Wed, 13 Nov 2013) Checksum: 532f4f7d32818e6c4ae084df046e1dab

CODParameter.name: Robs
CODParameter.Definition: Residual factor for the reflections (with number given by _reflns_number_gt) judged significantly intense (i.e. satisfying the threshold specified by _reflns_threshold_expression) and included in the refinement. The reflections also satisfy the resolution limits established by _refine_ls_d_res_high and _refine_ls_d_res_low. This is the conventional R factor.

CODParameter.name: Rref
CODParameter.Definition: This data value is not described in official IUCr dictinaries, but many CIF files use it. Should be roughly equivalent to Robs.

CODParameter.name: wRall
CODParameter.Definition: Weighted residual factors for all reflections.

CODParameter.name: wRobs
CODParameter.Definition: Weighted residual factors for significantly intense reflections (satisfying _reflns_threshold_expression) included in the refinement.

CODParameter.name: wRref
CODParameter.Definition: Weighted residual factors for all reflections included in the refinement.

CODParameter.name: RFsqd
CODParameter.Definition: Residual factor R(Fsqd), calculated on the squared amplitudes of the observed and calculated structure factors, for significantly intense reflections (satisfying _reflns_threshold_expression) and included in the refinement.

CODParameter.name: RI
CODParameter.Definition:
Residual factor R(I) for significantly intense reflections (satisfying _reflns_threshold_expression) and included in the refinement.
This is most often calculated in Rietveld refinements against powder data, where it is referred to as R~B~ or R~Bragg~.

CODParameter.name: gofall
CODParameter.Definition: The least-squares goodness-of-fit parameter S for all reflections after the final cycle of refinement.

CODParameter.name: gofobs
CODParameter.Definition: The least-squares goodness-of-fit parameter S for significantly intense reflections (see _reflns_threshold_expression) after the final cycle of refinement.

CODParameter.name: gofref
CODParameter.Definition: The least-squares goodness-of-fit parameter S for all reflections included in the refinement after the final cycle of refinement.

CODParameter.name: duplicateof
CODParameter.Definition: Specifies that the COD entry containing this data item is considered to be a duplicate of another entry. The COD number of this other entry, which is considered to be "primary" entry for the structure, is specified as a value of this column.

CODParameter.name: optimal
CODParameter.Definition: Contains a COD database code for the COD entry that contains optimally solved structure for the crystall or compound under consideration. This optimal structure should be used for all inferences; the current suboptimal structure is provided for illustration purposes only.

CODParameter.name: status
CODParameter.Definition:
Describes the severity of errors if such are detected in COD entries.
Currently, permitted values are: NULL, 'none', 'warnings', 'errors', 'retracted'.

CODParameter.name: flags
text
svnrevision
CODParameter.Definition: The Subversion revision at of the file that was used to produce the SQL table row.
CODParameter.Explanation:
In the COD, all data are kept as files in CIF format and versioned in the COD Subversion repository. If a small corrections are made that do not warrant a new entry, a nee revision is created.
The Subversion CIFs are held to be authoritative and all SQL tables are (re)generated from them. The 'svnrevision' columns holds the revision number of the CIF from which the SQl table row under consideration was generated.
Small corrections are addition of missing information (bibliography, compound names, etc.), spelling corretions, or obvious data corrections attested by the original paper or by the authors.

CODParameter.name: date
CODParameter.Definition: The date the current row of the table was inserted to COD database.

CODParameter.name: time
CODParameter.Definition: The time the current row of the table was inserted to COD database.

CODParameter.name: onhold
CODParameter.Definition: Specifies the date when the atomic coordinates of the entry, which might be currently on hold (not public), will become available publicly.
CODParameter.Explanation:
When an author deposits a structure prior to publication in a scientific journal, she/he may wish to withold the structure temporarily from public display by COD so that structure is deemed original for publication purposes, or for possible patent applications. Still, the authors may need to obtain a COD identifier for their structure, to present in their publication(s).
The 'onhold' column indicates such situation; if this column is not NULL, it indicates that the structure is "on hold" (i.e. not displayed publicly) for the above mentioned purposes. The value of this column then contains a planned release (publication) date of the structure.
Before the structure is released, only cell constants, spacegroup, summary formula and compunds names (if provided) are displayed publicly by COD, along with the structure author names. The coordinates of the atoms are not made available to the public before the release date.
